thread.title: Gang steal '£100,000 of chips' in casino heist - and may be returning to play with them
thread.title_full: Gang steal '£100,000 of chips' in casino heist - and may be returning to play with them

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Gang steal '£100,000 of chips' in casino heist - and may be returning to play with them
text:
Grosvenor Casino on Bury New Road, Cheetham Hill. Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A gang broke into a casino and made off with playing chips thought to be worth more than £100,000. 
The robbers targeted the Grosvenor Casino, on Bury New Road, Cheetham Hill , on Christmas Day last year - the only day of the year the venue is closed. 
It is understood they used sledgehammers to smash into the cashier booth and then took a significant number of chips, believed to add up to more than £100,000. 
Greater Manchester Police confirmed no cash was taken during the raid. 
A casino customer said that since the Christmas Day heist, Grosvenor bosses have noticed extra chips in circulation at the end of the day. 
It is believed the thieves are returning to the casino to play and cashing in the stolen chips. Read More 
The customer said the venue has taken all of its £100 pink chips from tables in an attempt to stop the gang from cashing in. 
Glass surrounding the cashier booth is also said to have been removed since the break-in. 
A statement from Greater Manchester Police said: “Police received a report of a robbery at a casino in Manchester on Sunday 25 December 2016. 
“A significant number of chips were stolen and enquiries are ongoing.” Read More Multi-millionaire car dealer who murdered his wife is ordered to pay sons £1.5 million 
This week the casino is hosting events to qualify for the Grosvenor UK Poker Tour on Tuesday, February 21, and Friday, February 24 - a showcase event in the casino’s calendar. 
Tickets to participate in the main event, in March, cost £1,000, with top players expected to take part. 
The Grosvenor has been contacted by the M.E.N for a comment on the break-in. 
GMP are appealing for anyone with further information or any witnesses to come forward. Anyone with further information can call police on 101. 
Alternatively, call Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Read More
